prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.5, 0.0]. This will position the prism facing upwards. Next, create the 2D sketch on face 1. We'll have a single loop (loop_1) with four lines (line_1 to line_4) like so: 1. line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] 2. line_2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.625] 3. line_3: [0.75, 0.625] to [0.0, 0.625] 4. line_4: [0.0, 0.625] to [0.0, 0.0] These lines form a rectangle in the XY plane. With these lines, you have completed the 2D sketch for part 1. Now, scale the 2D sketch using the `sketch_scale` parameter, 0.75. Apply the scaling to the sketch to get a 2D sketch with a scaled rectangle. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.5, 0.0]. This will position the 3D sketch identical to the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.5 towards the normal, and 0.0 opposite to the normal. This results in a three-dimensional rectangular prism. Part 2: Modified Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a modified three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.25, 0.0, 0.25]. Create the 2D sketch on face 1. We'll have a single loop (loop_1) with four lines (line_1 to line_4) like so: 1. line_1: [0.0, 0.375] to [0.25, 0.0] 2. line_2: [0.25, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.0] 3. line_3: [0.5, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.375] 4. line_4: [0.5, 0.375] to [0.0, 0.375] These lines form a rectangle in the XY plane which will be used to create the "CutFeatureOperation" on part 1. With these lines, you have completed the 2D sketch for part 2. Since this sketch doesn't require scaling, we can proceed further. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.25, 0.0, 0.25]. Position the 3D sketch identical to the coordinate system. Perform a cut extrusion with the 2D sketch. Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.0 and opposite to the normal as 0.5. This will remove or cut part of the solid body, resulting in the final slightly tapered top rectangular prism. The dimensions of both intermediate parts are provided with the shape description. With these instructions, you should be able to build the parametric CAD model that meets the given requirements.</description>
